title: Unable to decode using SKBitmap.Decode when I create the stream or byte[] using RGBA32/Gray8 format image buffer
body:
### Description
I am trying to resize image buffers (RGBA 32bit/ Gary 8 bit) using SKBitmap.Resize method.
For creating SKBitmap I used SKBitmap.Decode which gives null when passed RGBA 32/8 bit byte[].

### Code

```csharp
    using (Stream stream = new MemoryStream(imageBuffer)) // imageBuffer is byte[] in RGBA 32bit or Gray 8bit
    {
        using (var original = SKBitmap.Decode(stream)) // original is null for me.
        {
            using (var resized = original.Resize(new SKImageInfo(width, height), SKBitmapResizeMethod.Lanczos3))
            {
                bufferOutput = resized.Bytes;
            }
        }
    }
```

### Expected Behavior

SKBitmap.Decode should give me SKBitmap object which I can use for further manipulaions.

### Actual Behavior
SKBitmap.Decode gives null when I pass RGBA 32bit or 8bit image buffer.

### Basic Information
- Version with issue:  1.60
- Last known good version:  This is the first version I used.
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: .Net Core 2.0
  - Windows Classic: Windows 7
- Target Devices:
  -   Windows Desktop machines but should run in .Net Core environment.

Whether SKBitmap.Decode is the right approach for creating a SKBitmap from a RGBA byte[].
Please suggest how I can resize a byte[] with SkiaSharp.

Thanks
Basanth
